alert.note: Alert for Bernalillo (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 31 at 3:40PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and west central New Mexico, including the following counties, in central New Mexico, Bernalillo and Valencia. In west central New Mexico, Cibola. * WHEN...Until 645 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 336 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstormsover the Rio San Jose and Arroyo Lucero. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Up to 2.15 inches of rain have fallen. Storms are also developing over Arroyo Garcia. Hazardous water levels are expected in these drainages as well as the Rio Puerco, including numerous Route 6 crossings in western Valencia and extreme eastern Cibola Counties. - The potential exists for flash flooding to develop. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mesita. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 120 and 125. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Arroyos, streams, and normally dry rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes. Water in arroyos can travel many miles and take hours to reach your location from upstream rain areas.
